page.title: 01MIDDLE FELL - ALSTON MOOR
page.content: MIDDLE FELL _ ALSTON MOOR An area of mainly open fell with rough grazing and pasture typical of the North Pennines. The area includes a little woodland (both deciduous and coniferous) and peat bogs. Dry stone walling is the main form of enclosure. Historically important as a lead producing area, the only mining activities now are for coal and building stone. It is an area of outstanding natural beauty and the Pennine Way runs through the south-west corner of the block. The main activity is subsistence farming, principally sheep and cattle. This block lies at an altitude ranging from 1000' to 1500'; this is the most significant factor affecting the geography of the area.
